meanings.definition: To change from a solid to a liquid by heat.
meanings.sent1: The ice cube will melt in the warm sun.
meanings.sent2: She watched the chocolate melt in the microwave.
meanings.sent3: The snowman began to melt, leaving a puddle on the ground.
meanings.sent4: His heart seemed to melt when he saw her smile.
meanings.sent5: The candle slowly started to melt, dripping wax down its side.

meanings.definition: To become liquid by absorbing heat.
meanings.sent1: The butter will melt quickly on the hot pan.
meanings.sent2: The ice cream started to melt under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: The chocolate bar began to melt in her pocket on a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: His anger seemed to melt away as he listened to her explanation.
meanings.sent5: The snow began to melt as the temperature rose, creating slush on the roads.

meanings.sent1: His hopes seemed to melt as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent2: The music slowly melted into the background as they talked.
meanings.sent3: Her worries started to melt when she heard the good news.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day will never melt from my mind.
meanings.sent5: The tension in the room seemed to melt away as they all laughed together.
